comment.author: 21734563@N04
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Veterans of the American Civil War, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 66406516@N08
comment._content: Fort Totten was about 1/2 mile from the Soldiers' Home, where President Abraham Lincoln relaxed during the summer months to escape the heat in Washington. These men may belong to the 3rd Massachusetts Heavy Artillery which garrisoned the fort in 1864. See also 111-B-383.
